citation.article-title: Woodsholea maritima gen. nov., sp. nov., a marine bacterium with a low diversity of polar lipids
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Woodsholea maritima sp. nov.
Woodsholea maritima (L. fem. adj. maritima marine).
The description is as that of the genus with the following additions.
Cells are 1·5–5·4×0·7 μm with a 2·5–12×0·14 μm stalk; optimal growth occurs between 5 and 100 g NaCl l−1.
Optimal growth temperature is 20–40 °C; some growth is observed at 10 °C.
Strains have no to weak α-chymotrypsin and N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase activities; some isolates including the type strain have very weak lipase activity.
Isolates have been obtained from sea water at Woodshole, USA.
The G+C content of the type strain is 65·2 mol%.
The type strain is CM243T (=VKM B-1512T=LMG 21817T); a further strain is CM251 (=LMG 21818).
